resources.string: Choose another player and guess a non-Guard card. If that player has that card, they are out of the round.
Choose and look at another player\'s hand.
Choose and secretly compare hands with another player. Whoever has the lower value is out of the round.
Until your next turn, other players cannot choose you for their card effects.
Choose any player. That player discards their hand and redraws.
Choose and trade hands with another player.
If the Don or Wiseguy is in your hand, you must play this card.
If you play or discard this card, you are out of the round.
Immune to other cards until your next turn.
Must play if you have the Don or Wiseguy.
Out of the round if you play or discard.
By clicking finish, you agree to the privacy policy and terms of use.
The Don\'s Darling is played over several rounds. During each round, you use your connections in the mafia or police to take out the competition for Darling.
The cards in your hand are your current connections. You will use them to take out the others.
To win a round, you must either have the highest value card at the end of the round or be the only player left in the round.
Take turns one at a time. On your turn, you will draw one from the deck. Then, choose, and play one of your two cards. The effect of your card will be happen.
Some cards will knock you out of the round. Another player has used their connections to knock you out.
Until the next round, your turn will be skipped, and you cannot be chosen by other players to play.
It is important to remember the cards that are played. You can look through the history of a round by looking at the chat history.
The round ends in one of two ways: when the deck runs out or when one player is left in the round.
After any turn, if the deck is empty, all players still in the round reveal and compare the cards in their hands.
If you have the highest-value card, you win the round and gain one favor token. You are one step closer to getting to Darling.
If there is a tie, no one wins the round.
If you are the only player still in the round (all other players are out of the round due to card effects), the round immediately ends. You win the round!
Wait for Host to start next round.
%1$s played the Policeman. They guessed %2$s has a %3$s. %1$s was right! %2$s was eliminated.
%1$s played the Policeman. They guessed %2$s has a %3$s. %1$s was wrong!
%1$s compared hands with %2$s using the Moneylender!%1$s\'s hand was better. %2$s was eliminated.
%1$s compared hands with %2$s using the Moneylender!%2$s\'s hand was better. %1$s was eliminated.
%1$s used the Moneylender but was eliminated by %2$s.
%1$s used the Moneylender to compare hands with %2$s. But no one died? %1$s and %2$s live to tell another tale.
%1$s used the Moneylender with %2$s, but it was a tie.
%1$s has played the Doctor. They are protected.
%1$s tried to play %2$s on %3$s, but the Doctor protected %3$s.
%1$s played the Wiseguy. %1$s forced %2$s to discard their %3$s.
%1$s played the Wiseguy. %1$s forced %2$s to discard their %3$s. There are no more cards. %2$s was eliminated.
%1$s played the Wiseguy, forcing %2$s to discard %3$s. %2$s was eliminated
%1$s played the Wiseguy, forcing %2$s to discard %3$s.
Darling was played. %1$s has been eliminated.
Darling was played. %1$s has been eliminated.
%1$s forced %2$s to discard their hand. %2$s had Darling! They were eliminated.
%1$s forced %2$s to discard Darling. %2$s has been eliminated.
Round over! %1$s has won the round.
Appears to have been a tie.
The game is over! %1$s has won the fight for Darling!
Room code not found, try again.
Let\'s play a game of The Don\'s Darling! Here\'s the code: %1$s
Please send an email to report a player. Afterwards, please exit the game through the settings.
User %1$s (%2$s) is being reported. (Please write down what happened.)
Appears to have been a tie.
Appears to have been a tie. %1$s, %2$s and %3$s have won!
Appears to have been a tie. %1$s, %2$s, %3$s and %4$s have won!
